parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To seek out, search for (implying the difficulty of the task). From ana and zeteo; to search out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
